intro: Stachys betonicifolia, commonly known as wooly betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and spikes of purple or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is known for its aromatic foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
